title: MOTD: Pundits analyse 'incredible' Phil Foden & Man City's other midfield maestros
description: Match of the Day pundits Jermaine Jenas and Martin Keown praise the "incredible" performance of Phil Foden and the rest of the Manchester City midfield in their 4-1 win over Brighton.

title: ‘I left university and adopted my brother and sister’
description: When Jemma Bere’s family was in crisis, she made a split-second decision that changed the trajectory of her life.

title: Climate change: How technology is helping cities tackle climate disasters
description: Cities are under threat from floods, forest fires and other disasters - how is tech helping with emergency responses?

title: Stephen Merchant: How Outlaws creator took comedy to the dark side
description: His show, which throws seven strangers together, is a far cry from The Office and Lip Sync Battle.

title: 'My student loan refund took six years'
description: Rebecca Gale says she was "shocked and then angry" the Student Loans Company took so long to repay her.

title: Iran: The painful choices of being pregnant and unmarried
description: Abortion or emigration are often considered the only way out by cohabiting couples who conceive.

title: China's hypersonic missile: Could it spark a new arms race?
description: China's firing of a new nuclear-capable missile carried on a glider has raised questions about a US response.

title: 'I've learnt to communicate through art'
description: Matthew Rutherford lost the ability to speak after a car crash but has embraced a new approach.

title: What's next after the release of Meng Wanzhou?
description: Ms Meng and the two Canadian Michaels are home - but will the relations with China ever be the same?

title: Kim Leadbeater: Serious conversations needed on safety for MPs
description: Kim Leadbeater says a "serious conversation" about the safety of people in public life is needed.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'minimalism'
description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

title: Newcastle takeover: Police investigate Crystal Palace fans' banner criticising Saudi Arabian deal
description: Police are investigating a banner by Crystal Palace fans at their match on Saturday criticising the Saudi Arabian-led takeover of Newcastle.

title: Record-breaking ferris wheel opens in Dubai
description: The massive wheel was opened in Dubai with a lavish fireworks display to mark the occasion.

title: COP26: Disruption forecast in Glasgow as busy roads begin to close
description: Key routes near the SEC in Glasgow will close over the weekend and some commuters are expecting "major challenges".

title: La Liga: Granada's Angel Montoro scores brilliant last-minute equaliser from long range
description: Granada's Angel Montoro scores a brilliant last-minute equaliser from long range to secure a 1-1 draw with high-flying Osasuna.

title: T20 World Cup: Quinton de Kock plays into his own stumps
description: Quinton de Kock is dismissed after the ball bounces off his thigh pad and into his stumps during South Africa's T20 World Cup match against Australia.

title: Fisherman's Friend tycoon leaves £41m to hometown Fleetwood
description: Doreen Lofthouse donates her fortune to a charity that strives to develop her hometown Fleetwood.

title: Covid: Dogs bought in lockdown being abandoned
description: A charity says animals that cannot be sold are disguised as strays so rescue centres take them.

title: Twitter says Online Safety Bill needs more clarity
description: The government says it will tackle extreme posts but Twitter warns Ofcom will be "muddling through".

title: Budget 2021: Ministers pledge £500m to support young families
description: A network of "family hubs" is to be funded in England to provide support services in one place.

title: Alec Baldwin told gun was safe before fatal shooting - court records
description: The actor was handed the weapon by an assistant director before Halyna Hutchins was shot, a warrant says.

title: Road sign bungle sees Yorkshire sign erected in Lincolnshire
description: The mysterious sign appeared on the outskirts of Sandtoft in North Lincolnshire earlier this week.

title: Football Focus: Leah Williamson laughed when told she would be England captain
description: Arsenal defender Leah Williamson tells Football Focus that she laughed when she was told she would be England captain, and reflects on her career with the Lionesses.

title: The 83-year-old clocking off work at Kelly's Hardware after 66 years
description: Oliver Tumelty has worked in his local hardware shop in County Down since 1955 but it is closing.

title: Record high migrant detentions at US-Mexico border
description: More than 1.7 million people were stopped in the past year, including 145,000 unaccompanied children.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Hollywood horror' and 'sluggish booster jab campaign'
description: Many papers lead on actor Alec Baldwin's "heartbreak" after he fatally shot a colleague with a prop gun.

title: Budget 2021: English city regions to get £6.9bn for public transport
description: The chancellor will announce increased funding for tram, train and bus services in England.
